components.text:
RISKPOOL SIMULATION

Thanks for helping us test the concept of Riskpool. We've created a fun and easy way to experience it:
A FEW THINGS BEFORE WE START

components.caption1:
Blogging and other sharing

We are trying to keep this quiet for now, if you're a twitter superstar or have a big network, we'd appreciate if you held back on sharing our masterplan for now ;)
components.caption2:
What it looks like

At this point, RiskPool isn't live. Everything you see today is just built for a simulation. We're playing a big game of "pretend" and would be very grateful if you could do your best to stay in character.
components.caption3:
Survey

After the simulation, we'd like to ask you a few questions. We can't wait to hear your feedback
components.caption4: Mobirise gives you the freedom to develop as many websites as you like given the fact that it is a desktop app.

components.caption:
Choose your own adventure

This simulation is like a "choose your own adventure" book, you can pick the character you want to play and make a few choices along the way.

The main plot is that you're signing up for Riskpool, where you're grouped with 9 other people and you each put in a little bit of money to insure some of your belongings.

The simulation pretends to last a full year and shows you what happens if you or someone else in your pool suffers a loss or damage to some of their valuable belongings. 


The big idea is that unlike insurance, Riskpool is really a community and it has your back.

If you need help, your pool members are more likely to help than an actuarial software algorithm from BigInsuranceCo

If you don't need help you may even recover some of your investment and build wealth. Have you tried calling your insurer for money back? ...I didn't think so.... ;)

components.text: Are you ready?
components.button: START

components.text:
The characters

You get to pick who you want to be!

components.caption1:
Bruce

Bruce has a job that lets him work remotely a lot, so the three most valuable things to him are his MacBook Air he carries everywhere, his fishing gear he takes to the river whenever he can, and his big flat screen TV.
components.caption2:
Sue

Sue is a "glue" person, she know a lot of people and is friends with everyone. Not everybody knows what she does for a living, but her life is built around her bike, her surfboard for the rare times she's alone, and her homebrewing kit.
components.caption3:
Ned

Ned is a creative friend, he is amateur photographer, rarely seen without his camera. He loves music, and bought himselves some turntables recently to have fun at home with is huge collection of vynils
components.caption4:
UNLIMITED WEBSITES

Mobirise gives you the freedom to develop as many websites as you like given the fact that it is a desktop app.
components.caption5:
TRENDY WEBSITE BLOCKS

Choose from the large selection of latest pre-made blocks - jumbotrons, hero images, parallax scrolling, video backgrounds, hamburger menu, sticky header and more.

components.text:
Welcome to Riskpool

Your friend just invited you to join. You can protect your valuables against loss, damage or theft

Your pool consist of Bruce, Sue, Ned and 7 other people. You'll load details about your valuables, (pretend) pay for your share of the pool, and live through 36 months / 3 years in the shoes of your character
Protect your laptop, TV, and fishing gear
components.button: Start as Bruce

components.text: Protect your bike, surfboard and homebrewing kit
components.button: Start as Sue

components.text: Protect your camera, turntables and vynil collection
components.button: Start as Ned

components.caption:
EASY TO USE!

You decide which specific items to cover under Riskpool. You'll upload some information about your belongings, attach a picture and a value estimate.

As Ned, you're covering your camera, your turntables, and your vynil collection

components.text:
Upload your valuables

Take some nice picture of your stuff, add some receipts if you have them, or anything that will help others see just how valuable your belongings are.

Get a value estmate

Make your own estimate in a few clicks! Your pool members will see these along with your list of valuables when voting for you to join the pool.

components.caption1:
Camera

Along with some accessories, your camera has been assessed a value of $900, so if you lose it or break it, you may be eligible for this much money from riskpool
components.caption2:
turntables

At $750 assessed value, you got yourselves a nice toy. If it gets wild at your next house party and somebody steals it or drop a drink on it, you could be covered for total replacement value.
components.caption3:
Vynils

It's hard to put a price on these, so we let you decide how much they're worth to you and your pool will vote on whether to cover for that amount. The value will also impact your premium (how much you pay). Let's go for $500
components.caption4:
UNLIMITED WEBSITES

Mobirise gives you the freedom to develop as many websites as you like given the fact that it is a desktop app.

components.text: Your 3 most prized possessions = $2,150. Add a few more things and a general coverage for $2,500 gets you all set!

Your total covered value  $3,650

Your annual premium $60
components.button: Keep on Ned'ing

components.text:
RiskPool: The peer-to-peer insurance that builds wealth

Riskpool is about protecting the thing you care about during rainy days.

Riskpool is about building your wealth during sunny days.

Riskpool is about social.

Riskpool is your community, your friends, having your back... and you having theirs.


... So you can focus on the things that matter to you
Loader icon, credits to https://dribbble.com/shots/2235810-Loader-v6

HOW IT WORKS

In Riskpool you and 9 to 14 others pool together to insure your valuable belongings.

Your individual account has a certain amount of coverage, protecting your valuables

The group you're a part of is your POOL. Each POOL member pays a fair share of the POOL's premiums (contributions) relative to his/her coverage. The more belongings and valuables you protect in RiskPool, the more you'' contribute, and the higher share of the POOL you'll have.

When a loss occurs in your Pool (e.g. someone claims to have a valuable stolen), you and others in it vote to compensate to the person making the claim, we'll show you how in the simulation.

RiskPool has many POOLS so in the event of a claim (a loss, damage or theft of some Pool member's valuables), the reimbursement money works this way

* First, money from the individual account is used

* Second, money from the person's pool

* Finally, money from other pools and from RiskPool
FOR EVERY $100 YOU PUT IN RISKPOOL

components.list1:
• $30  to help other pools with claims of their own
  • Other pools help your pool and you as needed too
  • RiskPool manages the process
components.list2:
• $0 used if your pool has no claims
  • $60 from your pool before the community pool covers your pool claims
  • You vote on claims
components.list3:
• up to $50 back to you if neither you or your pool has any claims
  • The premium that gives back
  • We build your wealth
components.list4:
• No extra fees for claim processing, changes in coverage, deposits and withdrawals
  • Backed by investors, community-oriented

components.text: GOT IT?
components.button: START!

components.text: You're all signed-up, you could invite some friends to join your pool,

RiskPool is about community

The more you know about other people in your pool, the easier it becomes to vote on matters such as:

- Adding members to the pool

- Paying out a claim to reimburse someone for a loss

- Approving changes in coverages
This is what your pool looks like

At the beginning of every new year  for your pool, you can add new people, whether your own friends or friends of pool members

You and others vote on all matters, with a share of vote proportional to your share of the pool.

This year, it looks like that's it for now, you and the 9 people above are it!
components.button: Keep going

components.text:
TIME FLIES!

It's been 5 months already.

Thanks for being up to date on your monthly payments

You've put it  $25 in Riskpool (5/12th of your $60 annual premium)

components.caption:
FYI: General coverage in your Riskpool profile helps in several ways!

Whether you buy new cool valuables but haven't taken and uploaded a picture to RiskPool yet, or moved to a new zipcode with different risk premiums, or simply want to cover some various items not individually categorized and assessed in your riskpool profile, General coverage helps make sure you are protected adequately.


FYI: Documentation is you and everyone else's best friend

Uploading pictures of your valuables to RiskPool is the best way to give your pool members confidence in accepting you and your requested coverage in the pool

In the event of a loss, documents like police reports and other credible authorities will also significantly help your pool members vote on whether to reiumburse your for your claim. Our goal is to make it as easy as possible to document all that stuff so let your talent for photography shine but go easy on the filters and touch ups ;)

components.text: All is well in Riskpool-land
components.button: Keep going!

components.caption:
EASY TO USE!

You decide which specific items to cover under Riskpool. You'll upload some information about your belongings, attach a picture and a value estimate.

As Sue, you're covering your bike, your surfboard, and your homebrewing kit

components.text:
Upload your valuables

Take some nice picture of your stuff, add some receipts if you have them, or anything that will help others see just how valuable your belongings are.

Get a value estmate

Make your own estimate in a few clicks! Your pool members will see these along with your list of valuables when voting for you to join the pool.

components.caption1:
Bike

Your main ride, this bike has been assessed a value of $600, so if you lose it or someone steals it, you may be eligible for this much money from riskpool
components.caption2:
Surfboard

At $500 assessed value, you got yourselves a nice toy. If it get bit in half by a shark, it's nice to know you have the option to get reimbursed to buy a new one and get back in the water.
components.caption3:
Homebrewing kit

It's hard to put a price on the delicious beer you make, but we can at least insure the equipement you use to brew your liquid gold. Let's go for $400 of coverage.
components.caption4:
UNLIMITED WEBSITES

Mobirise gives you the freedom to develop as many websites as you like given the fact that it is a desktop app.

components.text: Your 3 most prized possessions = $1,500. Add a few more things and a general coverage for $2,500 gets you all set!

Your total covered value  $4,000

Your annual premium $66
components.button: Keep on Sue'ing

components.caption:
EASY TO USE!

You decide which specific items to cover under Riskpool. You'll upload some information about your belongings, attach a picture and a value estimate.

As Bruce, you're covering your laptop, your fishing gear, and your big TV

components.text:
Upload your valuables

Take some nice picture of your stuff, add some receipts if you have them, or anything that will help others see just how valuable your belongings are.

Get a value estmate

Make your own estimate in a few clicks! Your pool members will see these along with your list of valuables when voting for you to join the pool.

components.caption1:
Macbook

Your workhorse and worktool, this laptop has been assessed a value of $1,500, so if you lose it, break it, or someone steals it, you may be eligible for this much money from riskpool
components.caption2:
Flat screen TV

At $900 assessed value, you got yourselves a nice toy. If it gets tipped over by your drunk uncle or your sugar-loaded 8-year old nephew, it's nice to know you have the option to get reimbursed to buy a new one and get back that soap opera you're hooked on.
components.caption3:
Fishing gear

It's hard to put a price on the feeling of escaping this gives you, but we can at least insure the equipement you use to catch some of your best dinners, $400 of coverage should do it!
components.caption4:
UNLIMITED WEBSITES

Mobirise gives you the freedom to develop as many websites as you like given the fact that it is a desktop app.

components.text: Your 3 most prized possessions = $2,800. Add a few more things and a general coverage for $1,400 gets you all set!

Your total covered value  $4,200

Your annual premium $70
components.button: Keep on Bruce'ing

components.text:
Strolling toward the end  of the year, you've been with riskpool for 10 months now

Thanks for paying your monthly premiums on time ;)
BUT SUDDENLY!

Noooooooo!

One of your pool members, Bruce, is making a claim.

Bruce damaged his laptop, it's a total loss, he will need a new one.

In his claim documents he says that the laptop fell when he got up at a coffee shop, he'll probably get the data and his documents, but the screen is shattered and he will need a new laptop.

We had estimated the value of his laptop at $1,500

components.caption1:
Vote for a full reimbursement

We all make mistakes or are clumsy at times.

This will empty your pool entirely, and use some funds from other pools, your share of the pool will increase and Bruce's will decrease to 0% for now
components.caption2:
Vote for a partial reimbursement

It's unfortunate and you want to help, but you either feel that this isn't a qualified claim, or that the replacement value doesn't need to be so high. This would decrease your pool value, possibly to zero, but increase your share of the pool and decrease Bruce's
components.caption3:
Vote for no reimbursement

You feel this doesn't qualify as a claim, either it isn't properly documented, or the accident shouldn't be covered, or you suspect it's a false claim (fraud).
components.caption4:
UNLIMITED WEBSITES

Mobirise gives you the freedom to develop as many websites as you like given the fact that it is a desktop app.

components.text: Thanks for voting
components.button: Continue

components.text:
The Results are in!

Thanks for voting, we heard your point, and everybody else.

As a result of the group vote, Bruce will get a partial reimbursement, for $800. About $400 will be pad by your pool and the rest by other pools within riskpool

This will clear out Bruce's account to $0, and reset his share of the pool to 0%

This will unfrotunately also clear out everybody and the whole pool to $0, but you each increase your share of the pool by 1.35%

Other pools chipped in for the rest via the same 30% your pool contributes to Riskpool every year

At the end of your first year

Riskpool helped you help a friend, and had your back if something happened to your valuables.

Unfortunately, due to the size of the claim there's no money left in the pool, so let's stay on for a bit longer, shall we? We promise it'll be fun
In Reality, at Riskpool, every year end allows you to make the following choices

components.caption1:
Keep the course

If it ain't broke, don't fix it. Most Riskpooler will do this, let their share value appreciate and maintance the coverage and protection on the things they value.
components.caption2:
Make some changes

Changes to your coverage, addition of new pool members, or any other structural changes. A small percentage of pools might make those changes.
components.caption3:
Exit the pool

Whether to join another pool, to withdraw some cash from their account, or because they move to a country where riskpool isn't avilable, we expect some riskpoolers to exit every year.
components.caption4:
UNLIMITED WEBSITES

Mobirise gives you the freedom to develop as many websites as you like given the fact that it is a desktop app.

components.text: LET'S START YEAR 2. Thanks for playing along
components.button: Continue

components.text:
Your second year is already halfway done, and thankfully it's uneventful

If I'm not mistaken you've already rebuilt your account to $30 and your pool  is up to $200 

Insurance is about pooling risks with others, but realistically in a pool like yours, most years would pass without a claim.

That's another reason why Riskpool is awesome, let us explain...

While you make your monthly payments, you accumulate wealth

Unlike traditional insurance, Riskpool doesn't just protect your assets and valuables, it saves most of your premiums into your own account.

So time is your ally, as every year you carry over the money left in your account.

You should know

Riskpool uses "vesting" to protect your wealth, so any money you have contributed is fully yours after 12 months and won't be used to pay for other members' claims who are outside of your pool

You may use it for some of your claims though, or you can elect to withdraw it from Riskpool entirely without penalty after 36 months

Longer holding periods and vesting help us protect the integrity of riskpool and allow us to deliver better returns and benefits to users
Let's see an end of year summary
components.button: Continue

components.text:
Woohoo, the end of year 2

Let's see how things net out.

You have 11.4% of the pool shares

Year 1 took the cash value of your pool to 0 and your account with it

Year 2 on the other hand rebuilt your pool to $400, and your account to about $50
Let's get to the finiish line
components.button: See what happens in Year 3

components.text: Summary

This is what your pool looks like at the end of this adventure

There's $553 in your group pool, if you were to exit you'd be entitled and fully vested to 11.7% of it, or $64

This is what your journey looked like

You've paid about $180 to Riskpool over 3 year (your sum of monthly premiums is the blue bar chart).

Your pool was building up nicely but suffered two losses in Month 10 (which brought everyone to zero) and in Month 25 (which decrease a bit only)

Your friends Sue and Bruce benefitted from the protection and were able to replace their lost or damaged items

Your account built some wealth for you, while you were protected by Riskpool you were also accumulating cash, after 3 years you have saved up $65, over a third of your paid premiums!

Thanks for playing along as Ned

We'd love your feedback, please consider filling our survey, it's only 5 questions
components.button: START A Survey

components.text: IF YOU LIKED THE IDEA OF RISKPOOL, PLEASE FOLLOW US HERE FOR UPDATES AND NEWS ABOUT THE LAUNCH! And share us

components.text:
Strolling toward the end  of the year, you've been with riskpool for 10 months now

Thanks for paying your monthly premiums on time ;)
BUT SUDDENLY!

Noooooooo!

We told you that power cord was like a trip wire from other coffee shop patrons, turns out you're the one to send your own laptop crashing to the ground when getting up. It's a total loss, you'll need a new laptop... or to lean calligraphy.

You'll probably get the data and your documents back at least.

We had estimated the value of your laptop at $1,500, hopefully you can get a reimbursement close to that
You have to file a claim, let your pool know you'd like a payment towards a replacement laptop

components.caption:
DOCUMENT, DOCUMENT, DOCUMENT!

While there won't be a police report about you sending your own laptop to the junkyard, whatever you can do to prove the damage to your pool members will go a long way to sway their votes in your favor. By the way, you won't get a vote on this decision but below are the options your pool members are facing:

components.caption4:

Mobirise gives you the freedom to develop as many websites as you like given the fact that it is a desktop app.

You've paid about $200 to Riskpool over 3 year (your sum of monthly premiums is the blue bar chart). Unlike traditional insurance, Riskpool gives you back nearly $50 on that amount

Your pool was building up nicely but suffered two losses in Month 10 (bruce's, which brought everyone to zero) and in Month 25 (yours, which decreased a bit only)

You and your friend Bruce benefitted from the protection and were able to replace your lost or damaged items

Your account built some wealth for you, while you were protected by Riskpool you were also accumulating cash, after 3 years you have saved up $47, nearly a quarter of your paid premiums!

Thanks for playing along as Sue
